intro: Hieracium djimilense subsp. terekianum, commonly known as the Terekian's hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its rosette of basal leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, forming a composite head that attracts various pollinators. The subspecies is distinguished by specific morphological traits that set it apart from other members of the Hieracium genus.
